conclusion: A drives in from the bottom-right direction toward several groups of blocks and a marble to determine collisions and stopping point.
The image shows a green cloth with several blocks of different colors (red, blue, yellow, green, purple) and a marble placed on it. A car labeled 'A' is entering from the bottom-right corner.
The car is entering from the bottom-right and is aimed roughly toward the central cluster of objects.
The marble is positioned lowest in the path, followed by the yellow cube slightly farther up-left, and other cubes farther away or off-line.
The marble will be the first object struck by the car due to its position in the path.
A sphere like the marble offers a tiny contact area and rolls easily, so the car loses only part of its momentum while the marble is sent rolling toward the left side.
Because the hit on the marble is not perfectly centered, the car’s heading shifts a few degrees to the right.
The yellow cube will be the second object struck by the car due to its position and the car's slightly deflected trajectory.
The yellow cube is heavier, has a flat face, and grips the cloth, so almost all of the car’s remaining kinetic energy is dissipated during this collision.
After the second collision, static friction between the car’s tires and the cloth prevents further motion, causing the car to stop in contact with the yellow cube.
The car comes to rest touching the lower-right corner/edge of the yellow cube, more or less at the center-right of the cloth.
No other objects are contacted by the car.
